And the next thing I knew, I uh, I jumped on top of him and started wailing on him...And my friends, they just laughed and cheered me on. And afterwards, when I was sittin' in Vernon's office, all I could think about was Larry's father. And Larry havin' to go home and...and explain what happened to him.  And the humiliation...fucking humiliation he mustuv felt.  It mustuv been unreal...I mean,  I mean, how do you apologize for something like that?  There's no way...it's all because of me and my old man.  Oh God, I fucking hate him!  He's like this...he's like this mindless machine that I can't even relate to anymore..."Andrew, you've got to be number one!  I won't tolerate any losers in this family...Your intensity is for shit! Win.  Win!  WIN!!!"  You son of a bitch!  You know, sometimes, I wish my knee would give...and I wouldn't be able to wrestle anymore.  And he could forget all about me...

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: I think your old man and my old man should get together and go bowling.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: It's like me, you know, with my grades...like, when I, when I step outside myself kinda, and when I, when I look in at myself you know?  And I see me and I don't like what I see, I really don't.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What's wrong with you?  Why don't you like yourself?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: 'Cause I'm stupid...'cause I'm failing shop.  See we had this assignment, to make this ceramic elephant, and um...and we had eight weeks to do it and we're s'posed ta, and it was like a lamp, and when you pull the trunk the light was s'posed to go on...my light didn't go on, I got a F on it.  Never got a F in my life... When I signed up, you know, for the course I mean.  I thought I was playing it real smart, you know. 'Cause I thought, I'll take shop, it'll be such an easy way to maintain my grade point average...

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Why'd you think it'd be easy?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Have you seen some of the dopes that take shop?

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: I take shop...you must be a fuckin' idiot!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I'm a fuckin' idiot because I can't make a lamp?

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: No, you're a genius because you can't make a lamp...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: What do you know about Trigonometry?

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: I could care less about Trigonometry...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Bender, did you know without Trigonometry there'd be no engineering?

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Without lamps, there'd be no light!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Okay so neither one of you is any better than the other one...

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: I can write with my toes!  I can also eat, brush my teeth...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: With your feet?

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: ...play Heart & Soul on the piano.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I can make spaghetti!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What can you do?

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: I can...uh...tape all your buns together...

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: I wanna see what Claire can do!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I can't do anything.

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Now, everybody can do something...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: There's one thing I can do, no forget it, it's way too embarrassing.

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: You ever seen Wild Kingdom?  I mean that guy's been doing that show for thirty years.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Okay, but you have to swear to God you won't laugh...I can't believe I'm actually doing this...

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: All right, great!  Where'd you learn to do that?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Camp, seventh grade...

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: That was great, Claire...my image of you is totally blown...

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: You're a shit!  Don't do that to her you swore to God you wouldn't laugh!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Am I laughing?

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: You fucking prick!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: What do you care what I think, anyway?  I don't even count, right? I could disappear forever and it wouldn't make any difference...I may as well not even exist at this school, remember?  And you...don't like me anyway!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You know, I have just as many feelings as you do and it hurts just as much when somebody steps all over them!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: God, you're so pathetic!  Don't you ever...ever!  Compare yourself to me!  Okay?  You got everything, and I got shit!  Fuckin' Rapunzel, right?  School would probably fucking shut down if you didn't show up!  "Queenie isn't here!"  I like those earrings Claire.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Shut up...

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Are those real diamonds, Claire?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Or did your daddy buy those?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: I bet he bought those for you!  I bet those are a Christmas gift! Right?  You know what I got for Christmas this year?  It was a banner fuckin' year at the old Bender family!  I got a carton of cigarettes.  The old man grabbed me and said "Hey!  Smoke up Johnny!" Okay, so go home'n cry to your daddy, don't cry here, okay?

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: My God, are we gonna be like our parents?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Not me...ever...

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: It's unavoidable, it just happens.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: What happens?

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: When you grow up, your heart dies.

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Who cares?

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: I care...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Um, I was just thinking, I mean.  I know it's kind of a weird time, but I was just wondering, um, what is gonna happen to us on Monday?  When we're all together again?  I mean I consider you guys my friends, I'm not wrong, am I?

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: So, so on Monday...what happens?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Are we still friends, you mean? If we're friends now, that is?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Do you want the truth?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Yeah, I want the truth...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I don't think so...

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Well, do you mean all of us or just John?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: With all of you...

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: That's a real nice attitude, Claire!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Oh, be honest, Andy...if Brian came walking up to you in the hall on Monday, what would you do?  I mean picture this, you're there with all the sports.  I know exactly what you'd do, you'd say hi to him and when he left you'd cut him all up so your friends wouldn't think you really liked him!

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: No way!

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: 'Kay, what if I came up to you?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Same exact thing!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: You are a bitch!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Why?  'Cause I'm telling the truth, that makes me a bitch?

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: No!  'Cause you know how shitty that is to do to someone!  And you don't got the balls to stand up to your friends and tell 'em that you're gonna like who you wanna like!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Okay, what about you, you hypocrite! Why don't you take Allison to one of your heavy metal vomit parties?  Or take Brian out to the parking lot at lunch to get high?  What about Andy for that matter, what about me? What would your friends say if we were walking down the hall together. They'd laugh their asses off and you'd probably tell them you were doing it with me so they'd forgive you for being seen with me.

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Don't you ever talk about my friends!  You don't know any of my friends, you don't look at any of my friends and you certainly wouldn't condescend to speak to any of my friends so you just stick to the things you know, shopping, nail polish, your father's BMW and your poor--rich--drunk mother in the Carribean!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: And as far as being concerned about what's gonna happen when you and I walk down the hallways at school, you can forget it!  'Cause it's never gonna happen!  Just bury your head in the sand...and wait for your fuckin' prom!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I hate you!

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Yeah?  Good!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Then I assume Allison and I are better people than you guys, huh? Us weirdos...  Do you, would you do that to me?

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: I don't have any friends...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Well if you did?

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: No...I don't think the kind of friends I'd have would mind...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I just wanna tell, each of you, that I wouldn't do that...I wouldn't and I will not!  'Cause I think that's real shitty...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Your friends wouldn't mind because they look up to us...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: You're so conceited, Claire.  You're so conceited.  You're so, like, full of yourself, why are you like that?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm not saying that to be conceited! I hate it!  I hate having to go along with everything my friends say!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Well then why do you do it?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I don't know, I don't...you don't understand..you don't.  You're not friends with the same kind of people that Andy and I are friends with! You know, you just don't understand the pressure that they can put on you!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I don't understand what?  You think I don't understand pressure, Claire? Well fuck you!  Fuck you!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Know why I'm here today?  Do you? I'm here because Mr. Ryan found a gun in the locker...

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: Why'd you have a gun in your locker?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I tried.  You pull the fuckin' trunk on it and the light's s'posed to go on...and it didn't go on, I mean, I...

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: What's the gun for Brian?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Just forget it...

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: You brought it up, man!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: I can't have an F, I can't have it and I know my parents can't have it! Even if I aced the rest of the semester, I'm still only a B.  And everything's ruined for me!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Oh Brian...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: So I considered my options, you know?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: No!  Killing yourself is not an option!

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Well I didn't do it, did I?  No, I don't think so!

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: It was a hand gun?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: No, it was a flare gun, went off in my locker.

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: It's not funny...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Yes it is...fuckin' elephant was destroyed!

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: You wanna know what I did to get in here?  Nothing...I didn't have anything better to do.

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: You're laughing at me...

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Yeah you are! CUT TO:

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Brian?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Are you gonna write your paper?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Yeah, why?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Well, it's kinda a waste for all of us to write our paper, don't you think?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Oh, but that's what Vernon wants us to do...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: True, but I think we'd all kinda say the same thing.

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: You just don't want to write your paper...Right?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: True, but, you're the smartest, right?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Oh, well...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: We trust you...

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: All right, I'll do it...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Great...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Come on...

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Where're we going?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Don't be afraid.

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Don't stick that in my eye!

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm not sticking it, just close... just go like that...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Good...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: You know you really do look a lot better without all that black shit on your eyes...

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Hey...I like that black shit...

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: This looks a lot better...look up.

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Please, why're you being so nice to me?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: 'Cause you're letting me.

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: You lost?

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Cool!

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Thank you! CUT TO:

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Why'd you do that?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: 'Cause I knew you wouldn't.

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: You know how you said before, how your parents used you to get back at each other...wouldn't I be outstanding in that capacity?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Were you really disgusted about what I did with my lipstick?

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: Truth?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Truth...

Speaker: bender
Dialogue: No... CUT TO:

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: What happened to you?

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Why?  Claire did it!  What's wrong?

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: Nothing's wrong, it's just so different.  I can see your face.

Speaker: allison
Dialogue: Is that good or bad?

Speaker: andrew
Dialogue: It's good!

Dialogue: See ya Brian...

Speaker: brian
Dialogue: Hey Carl...

Dialogue: See you next Saturday...
